pull_request.title: Logging Part 7: Playback and Record Ignition Transport Integration tests

pullrequest.title: Logging Part 7: Playback and Record Ignition Transport Integration tests

content.raw:
~~I'm pretty sure we have a lot of tests in `ign-transport` that are likely to fail if multiple test jobs are being performed on the same machine at the same time.~~ Edit: It seems that most tests are protected by setting the partition to be a random number.

That being said, the [documentation](https://www.sqlite.org/sharedcache.html) (see the bottom section) seems to indicate that the in-memory database is only visible within the process that created it.
content.html:
I'm pretty sure we have a lot of tests in ign-transport that are likely to fail if multiple test jobs are being performed on the same machine at the same time. Edit: It seems that most tests are protected by setting the partition to be a random number.

That being said, the documentation (see the bottom section) seems to indicate that the in-memory database is only visible within the process that created it.

content.raw: Just checking, do we need to set `IGN_PARTITION` to some random value to avoid topic collisions when the same test is running concurrently?
content.html: Just checking, do we need to set IGN_PARTITION to some random value to avoid topic collisions when the same test is running concurrently?

content.raw: Should we check the return value? Consider this suggestion for the other tests if applies.

pullrequest.title: Logging Part 7: Playback and Record Ignition Transport Integration tests

content.raw: Is this file going to collide if two or more jobs execute this test at the same time in the same machine? If so, we could add some random prefix/suffix to the name. Consider this suggestion for the other tests if applies.
content.html: Is this file going to collide if two or more jobs execute this test at the same time in the same machine? If so, we could add some random prefix/suffix to the name. Consider this suggestion for the other tests if applies.

content.raw: I was forgetting to lock the mutex before passing it to `std::condition_variable::wait_for`. Should be fixed by 1f90b44
content.html: I was forgetting to lock the mutex before passing it to std::condition_variable::wait_for. Should be fixed by 1f90b44
